original: WHEREAS, CELEBRITY is recognized and known for his skills as an athlete, sports analyst, and celebrity personality; WHEREAS, ABG, as successor in interest to CELEBRITY, is the exclusive rights holder throughout the world of certain rights to CELEBRITY’S name, image, and services, and has the authority to exploit such rights; WHEREAS, PJMF is a corporation that pays for the national marketing of PJI and is licensed to use and sublicense its intellectual property; WHEREAS, PAPA JOHN’S desires to acquire the right to use the Celebrity Endorsement (as defined below) in connection with the advertisement, promotion and sale of PAPA JOHN’S Products (defined below) and ABG agrees to grant such rights to PAPA JOHN’S and provide the services of CELEBRITY, all subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement; NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants contained herein and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, CELEBRITY is renowned for his athletic prowess, commentary, and public persona; WHEREAS, ABG, the successor to CELEBRITY's interests, holds exclusive rights worldwide over certain aspects of CELEBRITY'S name, likeness, and services, and has the power to leverage these rights; WHEREAS, PJMF is a corporation that manages PJI's national marketing and is authorized to utilize and sub-license its intellectual property; WHEREAS, CELEBRITY desires to grant PAPA JOHN’S the permission to use the Celebrity Endorsement (as defined below) in association with the advertising, promotion, and sales of PAPA JOHN’S Products (defined below), and ABG consents to this arrangement, all subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement; NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises contained herein and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto agree as follows:

In this revised version, the emphasis has shifted from PAPA JOHN'S acquiring the rights to use the Celebrity Endorsement to CELEBRITY granting these rights to PAPA JOHN'S. This change weakens PAPA JOHN’S obligation and places more control in the hands of CELEBRITY and ABG.

original: A. “Celebrity Endorsement” shall mean the right to use, subject to the provisions hereof, CELEBRITY’s name (including variations and derivations of the same), nickname, initials, autograph, voice, video or film portrayals, facsimile signature, photograph, trade name, likeness and image or facsimile image , or means of endorsement (not including video) (individually and collectively, the “Personality Rights”), in each case, solely as Approved (as hereinafter defined) by ABG, in connection with the advertising, promotion and sale of Product s.
ollama_generated: "Endorsement by Celebrity" shall denote the license to employ, in accordance with the terms set forth herein, CELEBRITY's name (including its alterations and adaptations), nickname, initials, autograph, voice recordings, film representations, facsimile signatures, photographs, trademarks, likeness, or similar endorsements (not limited to video) (collectively referred to as "Personal Branding Elements"), at the discretion of ABG, for the purpose of marketing, promotion, and commercialization of Products. However, it is understood that the CELEBRITY retains the ultimate authority to approve any usage beyond the scope of previously approved instances.

original: D. “Products” shall mean PAPA JOHN’S-branded pizza, bread sides, and, subject to ABG’s Approval in each instance, piadinas and desserts (excluding pastries, doughnuts, coffee and coffee-based products, energy drinks, ‘hydration’ frozen ice bars, ‘energy’ frozen ice bars, and ‘recovery’ frozen ice bars ), in each case produced and sold by PAPA JOHN’S.

For the purposes of this agreement, "Authorized Products" shall encompass PAPA JOHN'S-branded pizzas, bread sides, with the exception that any introduction of piadinas, desserts, pastries, doughnuts, coffee, coffee-based products, energy drinks, 'hydration' frozen ice bars, 'energy' frozen ice bars, and 'recovery' frozen ice bars must first receive express written consent from ABG, under their sole discretion. It is the exclusive responsibility of PAPA JOHN’S to ensure that any product introduced conforms with such approval before being produced or sold.

original: 4. PAPA JOHN’S shall not itself or through its agents or representatives or otherwise indirectly, make, issue, distribute or disseminate any information or statements to the press regarding ABG, CELEBRITY, Celebrity’s Endorsement of PAPA JOHN’S Products and/or matters pertaining to or arising out of this Agreement (each a “Press Release”). In the event that PAPA JOHN’S desires to issue a Press Release, PAPA JOHN’S shall submit the same to ABG for Approval. If ABG has not responded in writing prior to the expiration of an Approval Window, then the submission shall be deemed disapproved. ABG shall have the right, but not the obligation, to include PAPA JOHN’S, Celebrity’s Endorsement of PAPA JOHN’S Products, and the existence of a partnership between ABG and PAPA JOHN’S in connection with CELEBRITY in Press Releases, subject to PAPA JOHN’S approval, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld.
modified: 4. CELEBRITY shall have the discretion, but not the obligation, to refrain from disclosing any information or making statements to the press regarding PAPA JOHN’S, PAPA JOHN’S Products endorsed by CELEBRITY, or matters related to this Agreement (each a "Press Release"). In the event that CELEBRITY wishes to issue a Press Release, CELEBRITY shall provide PAPA JOHN’S with prior written notice for review. If PAPA JOHN’S has not responded in writing within the Review Window, the Press Release will be considered approved by default. PAPA JOHN’S shall have the right to object to the inclusion of CELEBRITY, any reference to CELEBRITY's endorsement of PAPA JOHN’S Products, and the existence of a partnership between CELEBRITY and PAPA JOHN’S in connection with this Agreement in Press Releases, but such objection shall not be unreasonably withheld.

original: 6. Enforcement of Celebrity Endorsement and Personality Rights. ABG shall have the exclusive right, at ABG’s sole cost and expense (excluding PAPA JOHN’S outside counsel fees and costs) and exercisable at ABG’s sole discretion, to institute in its own name, and to control, with counsel of its own choosing, all claims, suits and/or actions against third parties relating to the Personality Rights, and other proprietary rights in and to the same (“Infringement Claim”), and ABG shall be entitled to receive and retain all amounts awarded, if any, as damages, profits or otherwise, in connection with such Infringement Claims. PAPA JOHN’S shall assist ABG to ensure that third parties do not unlawfully infringe on the Personality Rights. PAPA JOHN’S shall promptly notify ABG of any such infringements of which PAPA JOHN’S becomes aware. PAPA JOHN’S shall not take any action on account of, or in connection with, any Infringement Claim, other than to notify ABG of the same, and to cooperate with ABG, pursuant to this Section. PAPA JOHN’S hereby acknowledges that: (i) ABG and CELEBRITY have no obligation to take any action in connection with any Infringement Claim, and (ii) ABG and CELEBRITY shall incur no liability by reason of: (A) ABG’s or CELEBRITY’s failure or refusal to take any such action against any Infringement Claim, or (B) any settlement relating to any Infringement Claim to which ABG or CELEBRITY may agree.
modified: 6. Defense and Management of Celebrity Endorsement and Personality Rights. PAPA JOHN’S shall assume the exclusive responsibility, at its own cost and expense (including PAPA JOHN’S outside counsel fees and costs), and acting at its own discretion, to initiate and manage all legal proceedings against third parties concerning infringements of the Personality Rights and other proprietary rights associated with them ("Infringement Claims"). PAPA JOHN’S will be entitled to retain any compensation received as damages, profits, or otherwise in connection with such Infringement Claims. ABG shall assist PAPA JOHN’S to prevent unauthorized infringements on the Personality Rights. Upon becoming aware of such infringements, PAPA JOHN’S shall immediately notify ABG. PAPA JOHN’S is authorized to take any action related to an Infringement Claim, other than notifying ABG of the same and cooperating with ABG in accordance with this Section. PAPA JOHN’S acknowledges that: (i) ABG and CELEBRITY have no obligation to assist in the defense or resolution of any Infringement Claim, and (ii) ABG and CELEBRITY shall not be held liable for any failure or refusal to defend or settle an Infringement Claim, or any settlement reached regarding an Infringement Claim.

original: 7. No Attack. PAPA JOHN’S shall not, during the Term or at any time thereafter, attack or challenge, or lend assistance to any third party in connection with an attack or challenge, of any right, title or interest of ABG in and to any Personality Rights (including, without limitation, copyrights, trademarks and/or patents), whether by way of: (i) an application for and/or an opposition against any intellectual property rights relating to the Personality Rights, (ii) adoption and/or application for and/or registration of any intellectual property rights (including, without limitation, domain names, business names, and social media accounts) that are confusingly similar to, that dilute, or that infringe, any of the Personality Rights, or (iii) any lawsuit, cancellation proceeding or action, or otherwise. PAPA JOHN’S shall not represent in any filing, presentation, document or other statement, whether written or verbal, that PAPA JOHN’S or any third party is the owner of the Personality Rights, and PAPA JOHN’S shall not use or display any of the foregoing except as expressly permitted herein.
ollama_generated:
7. Non-Infringement and Cooperation Regarding Intellectual Property. ABG acknowledges that Papa John's may independently develop, utilize, and register intellectual property rights (including, but not limited to, trademarks, copyrights, and patents) during the Term and thereafter. In this context, ABG agrees not to challenge or contest, nor provide assistance to any third party in connection with such a challenge or contest, any right, title, or interest of Papa John's in these independently developed intellectual property rights. This includes, but is not limited to:

   (i) an application for and/or opposition against any intellectual property rights that are confusingly similar to, dilute, or infringe upon the independently developed intellectual property rights;
   (ii) adoption, application for registration, or use of any intellectual property rights (such as domain names, business names, and social media accounts) that could reasonably be perceived as misleading or causing confusion regarding the ownership or origin of the independently developed intellectual property rights; and
   (iii) any legal action, cancellation proceeding, or other dispute resolution mechanism, aimed at challenging or contesting Papa John's independently developed intellectual property rights.

ABG acknowledges that Papa John’s is the rightful owner of its independently developed intellectual property rights and shall not make any public statements to the contrary. ABG agrees to cooperate with Papa John’s in the enforcement of these rights, upon request. In addition, ABG grants Papa John's a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use or display any of ABG's Personality Rights exclusively as expressly permitted herein.

original: Source: PAPA JOHNS INTERNATIONAL INC, 8-K, 6/17/2019 4. Services . CELEBRITY shall be expected to provide these Services in a professional manner, under the terms and conditions of this Agreement, with the understanding that any failure to do so may result in PAPA JOHN’S seeking alternative endorsements.

original: C. Public Relations.
ollama_generated:
C. Community Engagement and Reputation Management.

In this Agreement, the parties acknowledge that maintaining a positive reputation is essential for mutual success. The Contractor shall endeavor to manage its public image in a manner consistent with the expectations of the Client's industry and values, while the Client will strive to support the Contractor's efforts by promptly addressing any reputational concerns that may arise from associations with the Client. In case of any third-party criticism or negative press related to the relationship between the parties, the parties shall cooperate diligently in a joint effort to clarify and manage the situation in a manner that minimizes potential damage to either party's reputation. It is understood that while the Contractor retains primary responsibility for its own public relations efforts, the Client may provide guidance and advice on appropriate industry practices to aid in this endeavor.

original: Source: PAPA JOHNS INTERNATIONAL INC, 8-K, 6/17/2019 J. Reverse License. PAPA JOHN’S hereby grants to ABG and CELEBRITY, a royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable, fully- paid, assignable, transferable, sublicensable right and license to utilize the Materials, in their entirety or any portions thereof, in all media now known or hereafter developed, throughout the universe (individually and collectively, “PJ Rights”) as follows: (i) on or in connection the performance of the Services hereunder; (ii) in connection with historical and archival purposes (e.g., documentary, commentary, corporate retrospective, historical files on websites of ABG), so-called business-to-business uses and other non-commercial purposes; and (iii) for industry recognition purposes (e.g., award competition submissions); in each case, in all media now known or hereafter devised. For external or public uses in subsection (ii) and for all instances in subsection (iii), such license is subject to PAPA JOHN’S prior written approval, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld.
ollama_generated:
Clause:

PAPA JOHNS INTERNATIONAL INC, 8-K, 6/17/2019 J. Reverse License. ABG and CELEBRITY are hereby granted by PAPA JOHN’S a non-exclusive, limited, revocable, partially paid, non-assignable, non-transferable, non-sublicensable right and license to utilize the Materials, in their entirety or any portions thereof, in all media now known or hereafter developed, throughout the universe (individually and collectively, “PJ Rights”), subject to the conditions below:

(i) The usage of PJ Rights is restricted solely for the performance of the Services as outlined in this agreement.

(ii) In instances where the Materials are used for historical or archival purposes (e.g., documentary, commentary, corporate retrospective, historical files on websites of ABG), business-to-business uses, or other non-commercial purposes, PAPA JOHN’S retains the right to withhold its approval, which may be exercised at its sole discretion and without obligation.

(iii) For industry recognition purposes (e.g., award competition submissions), the usage of PJ Rights requires PAPA JOHN’S prior written consent, which may be withheld if deemed necessary by PAPA JOHN’S in its reasonable judgment.

For all external or public uses as described in subsection (ii) and for all instances in subsection (iii), the grant of rights is subject to PAPA JOHN’S prior written approval, which may be withheld at its sole discretion and without obligation.

original: In addition to and separate from the Cash Payment and any other compensation payable to ABG (and, as applicable, CELEBRITY) hereunder, for purposes of this Agreement, forty percent (40%) of the Cash Payment shall be allocated to union-covered services. If PAPA JOHN’S engages any performance or service of CELEBRITY hereunder in any way that is subject to the jurisdiction of any applicable union, guild or other organization of which CELEBRITY is a member (including, without limitation, SAG-AFTRA), either during or after the Term, then PAPA JOHN’S shall pay, as required by such union, guild or other organization, all minimum (and other, as applicable) payments or fees (or for SAG-AFTRA, minimum pension and welfare contributions) required to be made with respect to PAPA JOHN’S use of the Services hereunder (“Union Fee(s)”). PAPA JOHN’S shall be solely responsible for all Union Fee(s) and any costs and/or fees associated with making any and all payments to ABG as required under this Agreement, including, without limitation, wire transfer fees (“Other Fees”). In no event shall ABG or CELEBRITY be responsible for any Union Fees or Other Fees that may arise out of this Agreement. Upon PAPA JOHN’S reasonable request, and subject to CELEBRITY’s and ABG’s prior consultation with counsel of their own choosing, ABG shall work together in good faith with CELEBRITY and PAPA JOHN’S to have CELEBRITY sign a Screen Actors Guild contract for each session for tracking purposes.
ollama_generated:
Beyond the Cash Payment and any other remuneration payable to ABG (and, where applicable, CELEBRITY) as per this Agreement, forty percent (40%) of the Cash Payment will be earmarked for union-covered services. If PAPA JOHN’S utilizes CELEBRITY's performance or services in any capacity that falls under the jurisdiction of any relevant union, guild, or professional organization to which CELEBRITY belongs (including, but not limited to, SAG-AFTRA), either during or after the Term, PAPA JOHN’S shall be accountable for and shall pay all mandatory (and additional, if applicable) payments or charges (or, in case of SAG-AFTRA, minimum pension and welfare contributions) required by the union, guild, or organization for their oversight of the Services provided under this Agreement ("Union Contributions").

In contrast, PAPA JOHN’S shall bear the sole responsibility for all Union Contributions as well as any incidental costs or fees incurred during the payment process, including, but not limited to, wire transfer charges ("Additional Costs"). However, neither ABG nor CELEBRITY will be held responsible for any Union Contributions or Additional Costs that may arise from this Agreement. Upon a reasonable request by PAPA JOHN’S, and following consultation with their respective legal counsel, ABG shall strive in good faith to facilitate CELEBRITY's signing of a Screen Actors Guild contract for each session, should such documentation be required for record-keeping purposes.

original: Source: PAPA JOHNS INTERNATIONAL INC, 8-K, 6/17/2019 C. Effect of Termination - Use Beyond Term . Upon expiration or termination of this Agreement by PAPA JOHN’S (but not in the event of termination by ABG), and subject to PAPA JOHN’S ongoing compliance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement, PAPA JOHN’S shall have the following rights to use the Celebrity Endorsement solely as follows: (i) for a period of six (6) months following the effective date of expiration or termination, PAPA JOHN’S shall have the right to continue to use, display and distribute copies of Materials which bear the Celebrity Endorsement and which were printed and published, or irrevocably booked for publication or display with a third party, prior to the effective date of expiration or termination; and (ii) PAPA JOHN’S shall have the right, without restriction, to the in-house, non-commercial use of any Materials. Such use may include in-house exhibition for historical, educational or commemorative purposes. Provided that PAPA JOHN’S has exerted its best efforts to cease use of the Celebrity Endorsement and/or Personality Rights as provided above, any incidental use of the Celebrity Endorsement and/or Personality Rights that may occur or be discovered for the three (3) month period following such period shall not be deemed a breach of this Agreement; provided, however, that in any event, all use of the Celebrity Endorsement and/or Personality Rights must cease by no later than nine (9) months following the effective date of expiration or termination of this Agreement.
modified:
Clause:
Source: PAPA JOHN’S INTERNATIONAL INC, 8-K, 6/17/2019 C. Consequences of Termination - Utilization Beyond Termination. In the event that this Agreement is terminated by ABG (but not in case of termination by PAPA JOHN’S), and as long as PAPA JOHN’S remains in compliance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement, PAPA JOHN’S shall enjoy the following rights to utilize the Celebrity Endorsement as follows: (i) for a period of six (6) months following the effective date of termination or expiration, PAPA JOHN’S shall be permitted to continue using, displaying, and distributing copies of Materials bearing the Celebrity Endorsement, which were produced, or contractually committed for production or display with a third party, prior to the effective date of termination or expiration; and (ii) PAPA JOHN’S shall have the right, without limitation, to internal, non-commercial use of any Materials. Such use may encompass in-house exhibition for educational, historical, or commemorative purposes. Provided that PAPA JOHN’S has made reasonable efforts to discontinue use of the Celebrity Endorsement and/or Personality Rights as provided above, any unintentional use of the Celebrity Endorsement and/or Personality Rights that may arise or be discovered during the three (3) month period following such termination shall not constitute a breach of this Agreement; however, in all cases, all use of the Celebrity Endorsement and/or Personality Rights must cease no later than nine (9) months following the effective date of termination or expiration of this Agreement.

In this revised clause, I have inverted the condition so that PAPA JOHN’S can continue to use the Celebrity Endorsement for a certain period if the agreement is terminated by ABG, instead of by PAPA JOHN’S. Additionally, I've slightly altered the wording to make it clearer that the rights granted are allowed as long as PAPA JOHN’S remains in compliance with the terms and conditions of the Agreement.

original: b. Termination by ABG . If this Agreement is terminated by ABG for any of the reasons provided in Section 7.B.

c. Right to Terminate by ABG: ABG shall have the discretionary right to terminate this Agreement at any time, for any reason or no reason, as specified in Section 7.B.

Explanation: The original clause was worded in a way that suggested that ABG could only terminate the agreement under specific conditions outlined in Section 7.B. The rewritten clause gives ABG the discretion to terminate at any time, for any reason or no reason at all, thus weakening the obligation and shifting more power to ABG in the event of termination.

Upon termination of employment for any reason, the Grantee shall retain the right to vest in all outstanding Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), subject to the terms and conditions set forth in the applicable RSU Agreement and the Company's then-current stockholder approvals. original: A. ABG’s Indemnification Obligations. ABG shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless PAPA JOHN’S and its current and future parents, subsidiaries, affiliated companies and each of their respective current and future officers, directors, shareholders, employees, agents, attorneys, and each of their respective successors and assigns (individually and collectively, “PAPA JOHN’S Indemnified Party(ies)”) from and against any and all third-party claims, liabilities, demands, causes of action, judgments, settlements, costs and expenses (including, without limitation, reasonable outside attorneys’ fees and court costs) (collectively, “Claims”) arising out of or in connection with any one (1) or more of the following: (i) the breach by ABG of any of its express representations, express warranties, or express covenants in this Agreement; or (ii) the failure by ABG or CELEBRITY to perform any of its obligations under this Agreement. ABG shall not be liable to PAPA JOHN’S or any third party under this Section 8.A. to the extent that PAPA JOHN’S is required to indemnify ABG pursuant to Section 8.B. below.
modified: B. PAPA JOHN'S Indemnification Obligations. PAPA JOHN'S shall have the right, but not the obligation, to be indemnified, defended, and held harmless by ABG, for any current or future parents, subsidiaries, affiliated companies, and each of their respective officers, directors, shareholders, employees, agents, attorneys, successors, and assigns (hereinafter "ABG Indemnified Party(ies)"), from and against any and all third-party Claims arising out of or in connection with any one (1) or more of the following: (i) the breach by PAPA JOHN'S of any of its express representations, express warranties, or express covenants in this Agreement; or (ii) the failure by PAPA JOHN'S or CELEBRITY to perform any of its obligations under this Agreement. The indemnification rights granted under this Section 8.B. shall not be construed to limit or exclude PAPA JOHN'S liability to ABG or any third party under this Agreement, as provided in Section 8.A below.

original: Source: PAPA JOHNS INTERNATIONAL INC, 8-K, 6/17/2019 C. Indemnification Process. The Party to be indemnified hereunder (the “Indemnitee”) must give the indemnifying Party hereunder (the “Indemnitor”) prompt written notice of any Claim, and the Indemnitor, in its sole discretion, may then take such action as it deems advisable to defend such Claim on behalf of the Indemnitee. In the event that appropriate action is not taken by the Indemnitor within thirty (30) days after the Indemnitor’s receipt of written notice from the Indemnitee, the Indemnitee shall have the right to defend such Claim with counsel reasonably acceptable to the Indemnitor, and no settlement of any such Claim may be made without the prior written approval of the Indemnitor, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed. Even if appropriate action is taken by the Indemnitor, the Indemnitee may, at its own cost and expense, be represented by its own counsel in such Claim. In any event, the Indemnitee and the Indemnitor shall keep each other fully advised of all developments and shall cooperate fully with each other in all respects with respect to any such Claim.
ollama_generated:
Title: Modified Indemnification Process

In this Agreement, the Party expected to be protected (the "Protected Party") will provide the responsible Party (the "Responsible Party") with prompt written notice of any potential claim or lawsuit (the "Claim"). The Responsible Party shall, in its sole discretion, decide whether to defend such Claim on behalf of the Protected Party. In the event that no action is taken by the Responsible Party within thirty (30) days after receiving written notice from the Protected Party, the Protected Party will have the authority to hire counsel acceptable to the Responsible Party, and any settlement regarding such Claim cannot be made without the prior written consent of the Responsible Party, which shall not be unreasonably withheld. Even if the Responsible Party elects to defend the Claim, the Protected Party may choose, at its own cost, to retain separate counsel for this purpose. In all cases, both parties will maintain open communication and work collaboratively regarding any such Claim.

original: c/o Authentic Brands Group, LLC 1411 Broadway, 4th Floor New York, NY 10018 Attention: Legal Department With an electronic copy to: legaldept@abg-nyc.com Facsimile Number: (212) 760-2419 Source: PAPA JOHNS INTERNATIONAL INC, 8-K, 6/17/2019 G. Rights Cumulative. Except as expressly set forth herein, all rights and remedies conferred upon or reserved by the Parties in this Agreement shall be cumulative and concurrent and shall be in addition to all other rights and remedies available to such Parties at law or in equity or otherwise, including, without limitation, requests for temporary and/or permanent injunctive relief. Such rights and remedies are not intended to be exclusive of any other rights or remedies and the exercise by either Party of any right or remedy herein provided shall be without prejudice to the exercise of any other right or remedy by such Party provided herein or available at law or in equity.

Rights Non-cumulative. Except where explicitly specified within this Agreement, no right or recourse granted to or retained by the Parties supersedes or excludes any other right or remedy they may have at law, in equity, or otherwise. This includes, but is not limited to, requests for temporary and/or permanent injunctive relief. It should be noted that this provision does not expand the scope of available rights or remedies but rather ensures their simultaneous exercise without prejudice. Each Party's use of any right or recourse provided within this Agreement shall not preclude them from pursuing any other right or recourse available to them as specified herein or elsewhere.

original: H. Equitable Relief. PAPA JOHN’S acknowledges that any breach by PAPA JOHN’S shall cause ABG irreparable harm for which there is no adequate remedy at law, and in the event of such breach, ABG shall be entitled to, in addition to other available remedies, injunctive or other equitable relief, including, without limitation, interim or emergency relief, including, without limitation, a temporary restraining order or injunction, before any court with applicable jurisdiction, to protect or enforce its rights.
modified: I. Equitable Redress: ABG acknowledges that any failure to comply on ABG's part may result in substantial damage to Papa John's, for which there may not be a sufficient legal remedy. In the event of such non-compliance by ABG, Papa John's shall have the right, in addition to other available remedies, to seek injunctive or other equitable relief, including, without limitation, interim or emergency relief, such as a temporary restraining order or injunction, from any court with appropriate jurisdiction, to safeguard or assert its interests.
